questions.questionText: The average of 6 numbers is 30. If one number 42 is excluded, what is the new average?
questions.explanation: Original sum = 30 × 6 = 180. After excluding 42: New sum = 180 - 42 = 138. New count = 5. New average = 138/5 = 27.6 ≈ 28. Answer: 28.

questions.questionText: A person travels from A to B at 40 km/h and returns from B to A at 60 km/h. What is the average speed for the entire journey?
questions.explanation: For equal distances: Average speed = (2×v₁×v₂)/(v₁+v₂) = (2×40×60)/(40+60) = 4800/100 = 48 km/h. Answer: 48 km/h.

questions.questionText: The average of first 10 natural numbers is 5.5 and the average of first 10 even natural numbers is 11. What is the sum of both averages?
questions.explanation: Average of first 10 natural numbers = (10+1)/2 = 5.5. Average of first 10 even numbers = 10+1 = 11. Sum = 5.5 + 11 = 16.5. Answer: 16.5.
